{"step_by_step_thinking": "Fordyce's spots are sebaceous glands that are visible and can appear in various parts of the body, including the mouth. They are not associated with any disease or illness and are not infectious. They are not red spots, nor are they fat tissue embedded in the buccal mucosa. They can appear on the cheek mucosa lateral to the angle of the mouth, but they can also appear in other areas.", "answer_choice": "C"}
